org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction

Class SamResourceManagerDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.SamResourceManager
      • org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.SamResourceManagerDefault

  • public class SamResourceManagerDefault
extends SamResourceManager
    Implementation of Sam Resource Manager working a Plugin (either Stub or Pcsc) It is meant to work with a Keyple Pcsc Plugin or a Keyple Stub Plugin.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SamResourceManagerDefault

        protected SamResourceManagerDefault(org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.Plugin plugin,
                                    java.lang.String samReaderFilter,
                                    int maxBlockingTime,
                                    int sleepTime)
        Protected constructor, use the SamResourceManagerFactory
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin through which SAM readers are accessible
        samReaderFilter - the regular expression defining how to identify SAM readers among others.
        maxBlockingTime - the maximum duration for which the allocateSamResource method will attempt to allocate a new reader by retrying (in milliseconds)
        sleepTime - the duration to wait between two retries
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.exception.KeypleReaderException - thrown if an error occurs while getting the readers list.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:

      • allocateSamResource

        public org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.selection.CardResource<CalypsoSam> allocateSamResource(SamResourceManager.AllocationMode allocationMode,
                                                                                           SamIdentifier samIdentifier)
        Description copied from class: SamResourceManager
        Allocate a SAM resource from the specified SAM group.

        In the case where the allocation mode is BLOCKING, this method will wait until a SAM resource becomes free and then return the reference to the allocated resource. However, the BLOCKING mode will wait a maximum time defined in milliseconds by MAX_BLOCKING_TIME.

        In the case where the allocation mode is NON_BLOCKING and no SAM resource is available, this method will return an exception.

        If the samGroup argument is null, the first available SAM resource will be selected and returned regardless of its group.

        Specified by:
        allocateSamResource in class SamResourceManager
        Parameters:
        allocationMode - the blocking/non-blocking mode
        samIdentifier - the targeted SAM identifier
        Returns:
        a SAM resource

      • freeSamResource

        Description copied from class: SamResourceManager

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
